intro: Skiatophytum tripolium, commonly known as the Tripoli thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several small, hard seeds. Skiatophytum tripolium is often found in coastal areas and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
